definition: an agreement, usually between two armies, to stop fighting in order to allow discussions about peace
a job or piece of work that is often boring or unpleasant but needs to be done regularly
to make something clear or easier to understand by giving more details or a simpler explanation; to remove water and unwanted substances from fat, such as butter, by heating it
a small group of people chosen to represent a larger organization and either make decisions or collect information for it
to try to be more successful than someone or something else;  take part in a race or competition
a very hard building material made by mixing together cement, sand, small stones, and water
the act of condemning something or someone
a result of a particular action or situation, often one that is bad or not convenient
to plan secretly with other people to do something bad, illegal, or against someone's wishes
the set of political principles by which a state or organization is governed, especially in relation to the rights of the people it governs
someone who competes with other people to try to win something
to deal successfully with a difficult situation
saying that someone or something is bad or wrong; of the greatest importance to the way things might happen
